channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AL

item.title: Report X-2023080138
item.description:
Report X-2023080138

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-05
  • City: THEODORE
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package found in the unload leaking and foul smell, Qa clerk notified and given to the hazmat clerk to process DescribePack: leakage from seal DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: package quickly placed in hazmat tub and removed to hazmat area and hazmat clerk notified for processing

item.title: Report X-2023070336
item.description:
Report X-2023070336

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-30
  • City: DOTHAN
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: X-2023070336, X-2023070459: Package was offered to the spill clean up specialist at our station location in Dothan, AL. Discovered during AM sort operations, package was seen to wet on outside of fibreboard box indicating leakage from inside. Further inspection found that package contained 4 plastic jugs each containing 3.78L of Alligare Diquat Herbicide (UN 1760) placed in a Surge Broadleaf Herbicide for turf box, UN 3082. Each set of 2 jugs was placed in a plastic moisture barrier before being placed in the box. It was seen leakage originated from the caps of the bottles and is believed to have been caused by expansion due to local heat. SDS of Surge Broardleaf Herbicide shows commodity could travel under special provision A197. However, the SDS also shows product has a flash point of 57 C and a boiling point of 100 C. Flammable, packing group III. There are no marks nor labels on the package indicating the product being shipped was flammable. SDS for Alligare Diquat shows commodity would be classified as UN1760 Corrosive Liquid, N.O.S (contains diquat dibromide) There were no marks nor labels to indicate a corrosive product was being transported. Package was contained at location and is awaiting FAA disposition.

item.title: Report X-2023070310
item.description:
Report X-2023070310

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-21
  • City: OPELIKA
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS FOUND TO BE LEAKING ON BELT. DESIGNATED RESPONDER WAS NOTIFIED, DONNED PPE, PLACED PACKAGE IN SPILL TUB, AND REMOVED TO DMP AREA FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. UPON INSPECTION, IT WAS DISCOVERED THAT NON-REGULATED ITEM LEAKED. RESPONDER DISCOVERED INSIDE THE PACKAGE WAS AN INTERIOR PACKAGE WITH A LIMITED QUANTITY DIAMAOND HAZARD LABEL. RESPONDER CALLED THE HAZARDOUS MATERIAL SUPPORT CENTER TO NOTIFY OF UNDECLARED.

item.title: Report X-2023080122
item.description:
Report X-2023080122

  • Incident Date: 2023-04-21
  • City: EVERGREEN
  • State: AL

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg came off of trailer leaking, placed in container DescribePack: Loose cap. 2-1 gal plastic jugs of ZEP purple degreaser with no inner packing. Hazmat paperwork on exterior top of box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Immediately isolated by placing in container
